Media China Serukan Otoritas Lebih Keras terhadap Demonstran Hong Kong
04 Nov 2019, 11:28 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Beijing - Media pemerintah China menyerukan otoritas untuk mengambil sikap lebih keras terhadap para demonstran di Hong Kong. Seruan ini disampaikan setelah para demonstran merusak gedung kantor berita pemerintah China, Xinhua dan gedung-gedung lainnya pada akhir pekan lalu.
Dalam editorialnya seperti dilansir Reuters, Senin (4/11/2019), surat kabar China Daily yang disokong pemerintah China, mengkritik serangan-serangan "ceroboh" oleh para demonstran "naif", seraya menambahkan, "Mereka ditakdirkan untuk gagal karena kekerasan mereka akan berhadapan dengan beratnya hukum."
Pada Sabtu (2/11) waktu setempat, aparat polisi menembakkan gas air mata ke para demonstran berpakaian hitam-hitam dalam salah satu kekerasan terparah di Hong Kong dalam waktu hampir lima bulan ini. Sejumlah stasiun kereta bawah tanah dibakar dan gedung-gedung dirusak oleh massa demonstran, termasuk sebuah outlet kopi asal Amerika Serikat, Starbucks.
Media China lainnya, Global Times mengutuk aksi para demonstran terhadap Xinhua dan menyerukan tindakan oleh badan penegak hukum Hong Kong.
"Dikarenakan gambar simbolis Xinhua, perusakan cabangnya tidak hanya provokasi terhadap aturan hukum di Hong Kong, tetapi juga kepada pemerintah pusat dan China daratan, yang merupakan tujuan utama para perusuh," tulis media tersebut.

Chinese Media Calls For Lighter Authority Against Hong Kong Demonstrators
Nov 04 2019, 11:28 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Beijing - Chinese state media called for authorities to take a tougher stance against demonstrators in Hong Kong. This call was made after the demonstrators damaged the Chinese government news agency building, Xinhua and other buildings last weekend.
In its editorial as reported by Reuters on Monday (11/04/2019), the China Daily newspaper supported by the Chinese government criticized "careless" attacks by "naive" demonstrators, adding, "They are destined to fail because their violence will dealing with the severity of the law. "
On Saturday (2/11) local time, police fired tear gas at demonstrators dressed in black in one of the worst violence in Hong Kong in nearly five months. A number of subway stations were set on fire and buildings were damaged by mass protesters, including a coffee outlet from the United States, Starbucks.
Other Chinese media, the Global Times condemned the demonstrators' actions against Xinhua and called for action by the Hong Kong law enforcement agency.
"Due to the symbolic image of Xinhua, the destruction of its branches is not only a provocation of the rule of law in Hong Kong, but also to the central government and mainland China, which is the main aim of the rioters," the media wrote.
